newsitem.title: INDONESIA: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - Oct 25.
newsitem.headline: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - Oct 25.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Indonesian stocks on Friday:

** PT Nusamba, led by Muhammad Hasan, was reported to have bought additional Astra shares from government-linked foundations and the founder and president director of H.M. Sampoerna on the Surabaya stock exchange on Thursday.
The buying has taken Nusamba's stake in automobile conglomerate Astra to 18.36 percent, news reports said.
** The Dow dropped 43.98 points to 5,992.48 on Thursday after sliding 58 points over the first three days of the week amid stepped-up profit-taking.

** Indonesia was expected to offer incentives to local franchisers in a bid to compete against their foreign counterparts operating in the country, the cooperatives minister said without giving details.
** State-owned PT Bank Negara Indonesia (BNI), which plans to float shares in November, has set its offer price at 850 rupiah, a company official said on Thursday.
** The Jakarta Composite Index rose 0.03 points, or 0.01 percent, to close at 575.89 points after touching an intra-day low of 574.54 points on Thursday.
** On Friday, the Indonesian rupiah was at 2,325.60/25.75 in early trading against an opening of 2,325.50/26.25.
** Astra and cigarette firm Sampoerna on newspaper reports that PT Nusamba had bought a huge Astra stake on the Surabaya stock exchange on Thursday.
** Fishery firm Daya Guna Samudra following an encouraging debut on Thursday.
** Energy firm Medco Energy on market talk of a possible link-up with a foreign firm.
** Clothing company Great River on reports it had bought Ray Summers, a private Singapore-based company with a licence to distribute and sell Walt Disney Co's consumer products.
